question: MLB: Who will win Atlanta Braves v. Boston Red Sox, scheduled for August 9, 7:10 PM ET?
description:
In the upcoming MLB game scheduled for August 9, 7:10 PM ET:

If the Atlanta Braves win, this market will resolve to “Braves”.

If the Boston Red Sox win, this market will resolve to “Red Sox”.

If the game is not completed by August 16 (11:59:59 PM ET), this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Who will win Anthony Joshua vs. Oleksandr Usyk 2?
description:
Anthony Joshua and Oleksandr Usyk are set to fight a rematch heavyweight bout scheduled for August 20, 2022, 4 PM ET at Jeddah Superdome in Saudi Arabia. 

If Anthony Joshua wins his scheduled bout with Oleksandr Usyk, this market will resolve to "Joshua". If Oleksandr Usyk wins his scheduled bout with Anthony Joshua, this market will resolve to "Usyk".

If this fight ends in a draw, is not officially designated as a win for either Anthony Joshua or Oleksandr Usyk, is cancelled, or is otherwise not decided by or moved to a date after August 27, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official reporting from the live boxing match between Anthony Joshua and Oleksandr Usyk, however a consensus of credible reporting may be used.

question: Will ETH hit $2000 by August 19?
description:
This is a market on whether Ethereum ($ETH) will reach a price of $2000.00 or above between August 10, 2022, 9 AM ET, and August 20, 2022, 12 AM ET.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if $ETH reaches $2000.00 USD or greater within this market's timeframe. This market will resolve to "No" if the price of $ETH remains below $2000.00 for the entirety of this market's timeframe.

The primary resolution source for this market will be CoinGecko's 30min candlestick high prices, with "Sat Aug 20 2022, 00:00:00" as the last relevant candle used for the market. The resolution source can be found here: https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum. Note, this 00:00:00 candle lists the opening price at 11:30:00 PM ET and the closing price at 12:00:00 AM ET.

question: UFC 278: Who will win - Usman vs Edwards 2
description:
UFC 278 is an upcoming mixed martial arts event produced by the Ultimate Fighting Championship that is scheduled to take place on August 20, 2022, 10:00 PM EDT, at the Vivint Arena in Salt Lake City, Utah, United States.

This is a market on whether Kamaru Usman or Leon Edwards will win their rematch bout.

If Kamaru Usman is declared the winner of this bout, this market will resolve to “Usman”. If Leon Edwards is declared the winner of this bout, this market will resolve to “Edwards”.

If this fight is declared a draw, or if for any reason the match is not scored, postponed after August 27, 11:59:59 PM EDT, or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will U.S. inflation be more than 0.0% from July to August 2022?
description:
This is a market on a month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U), from July to August 2022.

Inflation is measured by a change in Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) on a seasonally adjusted basis, reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the index increased by more than 0.0 percent (on a seasonally adjusted basis) from July to August 2022 and “No“ otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS August 2022 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled to be released on September 13, 2022, at 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. 

 -------------------------

The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services.

Note that the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports seasonally-adjusted month-to-month inflation to only one decimal point (e.g. 0.7%, 0.6%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if seasonally adjusted month-to-month CPI-U is 0.0%, the market will resolve to “No”, if it is 0.1%, this market will resolve to “Yes”).
